citations.narrative:
The licensee has conducting regulated activity not authorized under the current Class “A” license. The licensee stated that
she occasionally buys and re-sells animals when she either has requests for a species that she does not currently breed
or when her sales exceed her currently available offspring. She stated that the last such re-sale of animals was in the
spring of 2023.
Records at the facility indicate that the facility has purchased 10 sugar gliders and 26 hedgehogs on 11-Febuary-2023, 14
sugar gliders and 20 hedgehogs on 04-April-2023, and 20 sugar gliders 22-July-2023. The licensee confirmed that these
animals were later resold. Additionally, an invoice dated 23-March-2023 recorded the purchase of 12 black bile spiny mice
which the licensee also confirmed were later sold. The licensee currently has no sugar gliders or spiny mice at the facility.
Class “A” licenses authorize licensees to sell only animals that are bred and raised on their property. Class “B” licenses
are required in order to purchase and later resell animals by another facility for re-sale. Failure to maintain the correct
license type is a violation of the AWA and impedes APHIS officials’ ability to track animals and ensure adequate welfare.
Correct by ensuring that a class “B” license is obtained before any additional animals are sold that are not born or raised
at the facility. Correct by 18-August-2023.

The facility is not meeting the record keeping requirements set forth by the AWA. The facility currently has an outdated
record of animals on hand. The licensee stated the record of animals on hand is updated with adult animals approximately
every 6 months. Offspring produced by adults bred at the facility are not recorded on the record of animals on hand. The
offspring are only recorded on sales receipts when they are weaned/sold.
Records of natural deaths that occur at the facility are recorded on cage cards but are not recorded the record of animals
on hand. Additionally, there is no record of animal euthanasia performed at the facility.
Sales records of animals sold do not contain all required information. The vehicle license number and state, and the
driver’s license number (or photographic identification card for nondrivers issued by the state) of unlicensed buyers are
not recorded.
Failure to maintain accurate records that disclose all deaths including pre-weaning and euthanasia prevent the Attending
Veterinarian from assessing care and APHIS officials from determining compliance with the AWA. Failure to maintain
complete and accurate records of acquisition, disposition, and record of animals on hand prevents APHIS officials from
disease tracking, tracing animal movement, and determining compliance with the AWA.
Correct by ensuring that the facility maintains complete and accurate records of all animals on hand, all animal
acquisitions (including the total offspring born of any animal while in his possession or under his control) and animal
dispositions (including those which die, are euthanized, sold, transferred, or otherwise disposed of). These records must
include all information required by this section, must be maintained in an accurate and timely manner, and must be made
available for inspection by APHIS Officials. Correct by 28-August-2023.

citations.desc: Procurement of dogs, cats, and other animals; dealers.
citations.narrative:
The licensee has knowingly purchased animals from an unlicensed facility which required a USDA License. An invoice
dated 23-March-2023 recorded the purchase of 12 African pigmy dormice, 12 black bile spiny mice, and 9 African pigmy
mice. The licensee stated that that they were aware that these animals were purchased from a facility that does not have
a valid USDA license.
Sales of wild and exotic animals is a covered activity; therefore, all sellers require a valid license. The inspector confirmed
that this facility does not currently, nor did they have a valid license at the time of sale of these animals.
Purchase of animals from unlicensed facilities limits traceability of animals and prevents APHIS officials from ensuring
that AWA regulations are met and adequate animal welfare is maintained at source facilities.
Correct by ensuring that the facility only purchases animals from individuals/facilities that hold a current, valid, and
unsuspended license or those which do not require a license. Correct by 18-August-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
DANA MILLER n
